context: The word 'alkoholi' is the partitive singular, genitive singular, and illative singular form of the Estonian noun 'alkohol'. It refers to alcohol as a substance or beverage. In different cases: - Genitive singular (whose/what alcohol): alkoholi - Partitive singular (some alcohol): alkoholi - Illative singular (into alcohol): alkoholi This is a common word in Estonian for referring to alcoholic beverages or the chemical substance alcohol, with all three grammatical cases having the same form in this instance.
